Package com.frogger

Class FroggerController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.frogger.FroggerController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Controller
    public class FroggerController
extends java.lang.Object
implements Controller

    FroggerController

    FroggerController is constructed to check and reset FroggerView's position and status. It is extends from Controller and it also enhance the connection between FroggerView and FroggerModel.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.4
    Author:
    Kejia Wu, scykw1@nottingham.ac.uk
    See Also:
    Controller, FroggerView, FroggerModel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void blockMove()
      Forbid player to move.
      void bonusPoints()
      The bonus point of 50 after player get a snack (bug in the end)
      void checkBoundary​(FroggerView view)
      This method will check current position of frogger and ensure it will not cross the boundary of the game stage
      void checkPosition​(FroggerView view)
      This method will check current height of frogger to ensure that player will get 10 points after each time he reaches present highest position.
      void checkStatus​(FroggerView view)
      This method will check frogger's present status, including:
      1.
      void resetToStart()
      This method reset the Ends status and player's life back to start after the game is over, because FroggerView is an independent object applying SINGLETON design pattern.
      void revive()
      This method resets the frogger back to start place after it is died, and check whether the game is already over.

    • Method Detail

      • revive

        public void revive()
        This method resets the frogger back to start place after it is died, and check whether the game is already over.

      • resetToStart

        public void resetToStart()
        This method reset the Ends status and player's life back to start after the game is over, because FroggerView is an independent object applying SINGLETON design pattern.

      • checkBoundary

        public void checkBoundary​(FroggerView view)
        This method will check current position of frogger and ensure it will not cross the boundary of the game stage
        Parameters:
        view - Present FroggerView

      • checkPosition

        public void checkPosition​(FroggerView view)
        This method will check current height of frogger to ensure that player will get 10 points after each time he reaches present highest position.
        Parameters:
        view - Present FroggerView

      • bonusPoints

        public void bonusPoints()
        The bonus point of 50 after player get a snack (bug in the end)

      • blockMove

        public void blockMove()
        Forbid player to move.

      • checkStatus

        public void checkStatus​(FroggerView view)
        This method will check frogger's present status, including:
        1. Die in the road (Road death);
        2. Die in the water (Water death);
        3. Reaches the end;
        4. Keeps alive.
        Parameters:
        view - Present FroggerView
